intro: Malope malacoides proles trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed malope, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and distinctive trifid (three-lobed) leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a unique and ornamental species within its native habitat.
